meanings.sent1: She felt disserve when her boss unfairly blamed her for the mistake.
meanings.sent2: It would disserve him if he was punished for something he didn't do.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought it would disserve the mouse by hiding its toy, but the mouse found it anyway.
meanings.sent4: The storm's sudden arrival disserve the outdoor wedding plans.
meanings.sent5: The broken umbrella disserve no purpose in the heavy rain.

meanings.definition: To fail to benefit or help someone.
meanings.sent1: Skipping breakfast would disserve your health in the long run.
meanings.sent2: It would disserve the team if the captain didn't show up for the game.
meanings.sent3: The magician's disappearing act seemed to disserve the audience's expectations.
meanings.sent4: The wilted flowers disserve the beauty of the garden.
meanings.sent5: His refusal to accept help only served to disserve himself.

meanings.definition: To act in a way that is detrimental to someone's interests.
meanings.sent1: His constant lying would only disserve his reputation in the community.
meanings.sent2: The company's decision to cut corners ended up disserving its customers.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous elf tried to disserve Santa's efforts by hiding the presents.
meanings.sent4: The leaky roof disserve the homeowner's efforts to keep the house dry.
meanings.sent5: The negative comments online disserve the hard work of the restaurant staff.
